intro: Tibouchina calycina, commonly known as the velvetleaf tibouchina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in a fine, velvety texture. Tibouchina calycina produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of pink, red, or purple, which bloom throughout the warmer months.
